  'pages_text': ['                                                            PURCHASE CONTRACT\n'
                 '\n'
                 '                                                               Contract No. '
                 'SAMPLE\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 'THIS PURCHASE CONTRACT (the “ Contract”) entered into as of __________ by and '
                 'between\n'
                 'MERCY CORPS, a State of Washington, U.S.A. nonprofit corporation having its '
                 'principal office in\n'
                 'Portland, Oregon, U.S.A. (“Mercy Corps”) and _____________________________ ("  '
                 'Supplier") is\n'
                 'as follows:\n'
                 '\n'
                 '1.                        Defined Terms.   Each of the following terms has the '
                 'meaning given to such term on Schedule I\n'
                 'attached hereto:  Authorized Representative, Contract Number, Delivery Date, '
                 'Delivery Location,\n'
                 'Delivery Terms, Donor Terms, Goods , Packing Requirements, Pricing,  and '
                 'Specifications.  Other terms\n'
                 'are defined as specified throughout this Contract.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '2.                           Purchase and Sale of Goods.   Supplier will sell to '
                 'Mercy Corps, and Mercy Corps will purchase\n'
                 'and pay for, the Goods in accordance with the te rms and conditions set forth in '
                 'this Contract.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '3.                           Specifications.   The Goods must strictly comply '
                 'with or exceed the Specifications listed in\n'
                 'Schedule II.  No deviation, substitution or change is permitted without Mercy '
                 'Corps’ prior written\n'
                 'consent.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '4.                      Purchase Order Amendments.  Mercy Corps may suspend '
                 "Supplier's performance, increase or\n"
                 'decrease the ordered quantities, or make changes for Mercy Corps’ reasonable '
                 'business needs by\n'
                 'written notice to Supplier (each, a “Purchase Order Amendment").  Unless '
                 'mutually agreed, a\n'
                 'Purchase Order Amendment does not apply to change the Goods timely and fully '
                 'delivered and\n'
                 'accepted before the date of the Purchase Order Amendment.  If any change causes '
                 'an increase or\n'
                 "decrease in the cost of, or the time required for, Supplier's performance, an "
                 'equitable adjustment may\n'
                 'be made in the price or delivery schedule or both, if  such adjustment is set '
                 'forth in a Purchase Order\n'
                 'Amendment signed by the Authorized Representative.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '5.                           Non-Exclusivity.  This Contract is not intended to '
                 'create an exclusive relationship between the\n'
                 '      parties.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '6.                          Inspection, Acceptance and Rejection.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      a.                                    All Goods will be subject to Mercy '
                 "Corps' insp ection and testing (which may be done by a third\n"
                 '             party authorized by Mercy Corps), at any time and place, including '
                 'the period of\n'
                 '             manufacture/production/creation and before final acc eptance.  If '
                 'Mercy Corps inspects or tests\n'
                 "             at Supplier's premises, Supplier, without additio nal charge, will "
                 'provide all reasonable facilities\n'
                 "             and assistance for the safety and convenience of Mercy Corps' "
                 'inspectors.  No inspection or\n'
                 '             testing done or not done before final insp ection and acceptance '
                 'will relieve Supplier from\n'
                 '             responsibility for defects or for other failure to meet the '
                 'requirements of this Contract.\n'
                 '             Notwithstanding any prior inspections or paymen ts made, all Goods '
                 'will be subject to final\n'
                 '             inspection and acceptance at the Delivery Location  within a '
                 'reasonable time after delivery (but\n'
                 '             in no event, less than three days after the date of delivery).\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Purchase Contract No: '
                 'SAMPLE                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              '
                 'PAGE 1 OF 14',
                 '      b.                                 Acceptance will occur only when the '
                 'Authorized   Representative delivers written, signed notice\n'
                 '            of acceptance to Supplier in the form of a goods received notice (“ '
                 'GRN”) and such notice has\n'
                 '            been signed by Supplier’s representative.  The GRN must include: (1) '
                 'the GRN number and\n'
                 '            the packing slip number; (2) the Contract number; (3) a description '
                 'of the Goods; (4) the\n'
                 '            quantity delivered; (5) final inspection date and  location; (6) '
                 'quantity accepted; and (7) quantity\n'
                 '            rejected or over-shipped.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      c.                              If any delivery, documentation or the '
                 'Goods deliv ered do not comply with all of the terms and\n'
                 '            conditions of this Contract, Mercy Corps may do one  or more of the '
                 'following: (1) reject such\n'
                 '            nonconforming Goods, accept conforming Goods  and reduce the '
                 'purchase price by such\n'
                 '            amount as Mercy Corps determines in good faith  reflects the value '
                 'to Mercy Corps of the\n'
                 '            accepted Goods, (2) accept such nonconforming Go ods and reduce the '
                 'purchase price by such\n'
                 '            amount as Mercy Corps determines in good faith re  flects the '
                 'reduced value to Mercy Corps of\n'
                 '            such nonconforming Goods; (3) reject all Goods;  and/or (4) '
                 'terminate this Contract without\n'
                 '            any further obligation on Mercy Corps’ part.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      d.                       If any Goods are finally accepted, Mercy Corp s '
                 'will only pay for the quantity accepted up to\n'
                 '            the quantity specified in this Contract.  Mercy Corps will in no '
                 'event pay for quantity above\n'
                 '            the amount provided for in this Contract or accep ted.  Mercy Corps '
                 'or its agent will hold over-\n'
                 "            shipments and non-conforming shipments at Supplier's risk and "
                 'expense for a reasonable time\n'
                 "            awaiting Supplier's instructions.  Supplier will be ar the expense "
                 'of return charges, storage\n'
                 '            charges and other expenses for over-shi pped quantities and Goods '
                 'not accepted.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '7.                           Packing.   All Goods will be prepared for shipping  '
                 'and delivery and will be shipped in accordance\n'
                 'with the Packing Requirements listed in Schedule I.  Price based on weight will '
                 'include net weight\n'
                 'only.  Supplier will not charge Mercy Corps for p ackaging or pre-shipping '
                 'costs, such as boxing,\n'
                 'crating, handling damage, drayage, or storage.  Supplier will mark all '
                 'containers with necessary\n'
                 'handling and shipping information, Contract Number , date of shipment, and names '
                 'of the consignee\n'
                 'and consignor.  A packing list, a nd other documentation required for dom estic '
                 'or international transit,\n'
                 'regulatory clearance or identification of  the Goods will accompany each '
                 'shipment.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '8.                     Transportation, Shipment and Delivery.   '
                 'Shipment/transportation will be in accordance with\n'
                 'the Delivery Terms, Delivery Date, and Delivery Location in Schedule I.  Mercy '
                 'Corps will not be\n'
                 'charged for shipping, delivery, loading or unloadi ng costs unless otherwise '
                 'specified in the Delivery\n'
                 'Terms.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '9.                            Risk of Loss.   Supplier will bear all risk of '
                 'loss, dama  ge, or destruction to the Goods, in whole or\n'
                 'in part, occurring before final acceptance by Mercy Corps at the Delivery '
                 'Location; provided, Mercy\n'
                 'Corps is responsible for any loss caused by its gross negligence.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '10.     Taxes, Duties and Expenses.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      a.      All taxes, duties and other governmental charges with respect to '
                 'the\n'
                 '            manufacture/production/creation of the Goods and  the delivery of '
                 'the Goods to Mercy Corps\n'
                 '            in accordance with this Contract will be the liability of, and borne '
                 'solely by, Supplier.  If the\n'
                 '            law requires Mercy Corps to withhold taxes from payments to '
                 'Supplier, Mercy Corps may\n'
                 '            withhold those taxes and pay them to the appropriate taxing '
                 'authority.  Mercy Corps will\n'
                 '            deliver to Supplier an official notice for such  taxes.  Mercy Corps '
                 'will use reasonable efforts\n'
                 '            to minimize any taxes withheld to the extent allowed by law.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Purchase Contract No: '
                 'SAMPLE                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              '
                 'PAGE 2 OF 14',
                 '      b.                           Supplier is responsible for all expenses incu '
                 'rred by it in performing under this Contract.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '11.     Invoicing and Payment.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      a.                    Mercy Corps will have no obligation to make any '
                 'payment to Supplier with respect to the\n'
                 '             Goods until final acceptance in accordance with Section 6(b) and '
                 'delivery of an invoice that\n'
                 '             fully complies with the requirements specified in this Contract.  '
                 'Invoices may only be\n'
                 '             submitted after Supplier receives a GRN.  Invoices must be '
                 'submitted within 60 days of\n'
                 '             Supplier’s acceptance of a GRN.  Mercy Corps will have no '
                 'obligation to pay an invoice\n'
                 '             submitted after 60 days or to pay an invoice  amount that Mercy '
                 'Corps disputes in a written\n'
                 '             notice to Supplier.  Each invoice must contain or attach the '
                 'following: (1) a copy of the signed\n'
                 '             GRN; (2) Supplier’s name and address; (3) description of the Goods '
                 'delivered, delivery date,\n'
                 '             quantity, unit price and total price to be paid;  (4) all '
                 'information necessary for Mercy Corps to\n'
                 '             implement payment (e.g., name of representative to address payment '
                 'to, address, bank account\n'
                 '             information as applicable for the method of pa yment); (5) the '
                 'Contract Number; (6) packing\n'
                 '             slip number; (7) taxes and duties (only if payable by Mercy Corps '
                 'per the terms of this\n'
                 '             Contract); (8) Delivery Location and Delivery Date; and (9) any '
                 'other information reasonably\n'
                 '             required by Mercy Corps.  Invoices will only be deem ed received on '
                 'the date they are delivered\n'
                 '             to the Authorized Representative and in fu ll compliance with the '
                 'requirements herein.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      b.                 Mercy Corps will make payment within 30 days of receipt '
                 "of Supplier's fully conforming\n"
                 '             invoice.  Payment of an invoice will not constitute acceptance of '
                 'Goods, and is subject to\n'
                 '             adjustment for errors, shortages, defects or other failure of '
                 'Supplier to meet the requirements\n'
                 '             of this Contract.  Mercy Corps may set-off amounts owed to Mercy '
                 'Corps against an amount\n'
                 "             Mercy Corps owes to Supplier or Supplier's affiliated companies, "
                 'and Mercy Corps will\n'
                 '             provide notice to Supplier within a reasonable time after the '
                 'setoff.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '12.                                                                                  '
                 'Representations, Warranties and Additional Covenants .   Supplier represents and '
                 'warrants\n'
                 'to Mercy Corps and covenants with Mercy Corps as follows.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      a.                 Supplier has full rights and authority to enter into '
                 'and perform its obligations under this\n'
                 '             Contract.  Supplier’s performance will not violate any agreement or '
                 'obligation between\n'
                 '             Supplier and any third party.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      b.                        The Goods and all documentation required will m '
                 'eet each of the standards and specifications\n'
                 '             set forth in this Contract.  The Goods are merchantable and fit for '
                 'their intended purpose,\n'
                 '             comply with all applicable law and are free from all defects in '
                 'material and workmanship.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      c.                             Supplier will deliver good and mark etable '
                 'title to the Goods free and clear of all liens, claims,\n'
                 '             encumbrances and interests of any other pers on, entity or '
                 'government.  The Goods will not\n'
                 '             infringe on any patent, copyright, trademark, trade secret or other '
                 'proprietary right of any third\n'
                 '             party.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      d.                      Supplier will comply with all applicable law, re '
                 'gulations and rules in the performance of its\n'
                 '             obligations under this Contract.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      e.                            Supplier has not, and will not, engage in '
                 'transac tions with, or provide resources or support to,\n'
                 '             individuals and organizations associated with terrorism, including '
                 'those individuals or entities\n'
                 '             that appear on the Specially Designated Nationals and Blocked '
                 'Persons List maintained by the\n'
                 '             U.S.  Treasury '
                 '(http://www.treasury.gov/resource-center/sanctions/SDN-\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Purchase Contract No: '
                 'SAMPLE                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              '
                 'PAGE 3 OF 14',
                 '             List/Pages/default.aspx) or the United Nations Security designation '
                 'list\n'
                 '             (http://www.un.org/sc/committees/1267/ aq_sanctions_list.shtml).\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      f.                    Supplier will comply with and train its employees in '
                 'all applicable laws against bribery,\n'
                 '             corruption, inaccurate books and records, inadequate internal '
                 'controls and money-laundering,\n'
                 '             including the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act and the UK Bribery '
                 'Act.  Supplier has not\n'
                 '             and will not offer or give any employee, agent,  or representative '
                 'of Mercy Corps anything of\n'
                 '             value to secure any business from Mercy Corps or influence such '
                 'person to alter the terms,\n'
                 '             conditions, or performance of any contract with or purchase order '
                 'from Mercy Corps, including\n'
                 '             but not limited to this Contract.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      g.                              Supplier does not own, directly or '
                 'indirectly,   any other company that was competing for award\n'
                 '             of this Contract.  Supplier did not seek or obtai  n confidential '
                 'information related to the award\n'
                 '             of this Contract from any Mercy Corps employ ee, agent or '
                 'representative.  Supplier did not\n'
                 '             collude or conspire with any other individual or   entity to limit '
                 'competition for the award of this\n'
                 '             Contract, to set prices being offered or in any other way to '
                 'interfere with free and open\n'
                 '             competition.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      h.                            Supplier is not owned in whole or in part, '
                 'dir  ectly or indirectly, by any immediate or extended\n'
                 '             family member of any Mercy Corps employee, agent or representative, '
                 'or, if so owned,\n'
                 '             Supplier fully disclosed such relationship and any   potential '
                 'conflict of interest has been waived\n'
                 '             by Mercy Corps.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      i.                      Supplier has not engaged in, and will not e ngage '
                 'in, any of the following conduct:  (A)\n'
                 '             trafficking in persons (as defined in the Protocol to Prevent, '
                 'Suppress, and Punish Trafficking\n'
                 '             in Persons, especially Women and Children, supplementing the UN '
                 'Convention against\n'
                 '             Transnational Organized Crime); (B) procuring a co mmercial sex '
                 'act; or (C) using forced labor.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      j.                     Supplier is not the subject or any governmental or '
                 'donor investigation and has not been\n'
                 '             debarred or suspended by any governme nt, governmental agency or '
                 'donor.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      k.                  Contractor [or supplier] understands that it is '
                 "subject to Mercy Corps' Child Safeguarding,\n"
                 '             Prevention of Sexual Exploitation and Abuse of   Beneficiaries and '
                 'Community Members, Anti-\n'
                 '             Trafficking and Sexual Misconduct policies (available at '
                 'https://www.mercycorps.org/who-\n'
                 '             we-are/ethics-policies). Contractor must report any violation or '
                 'suspected violation of these\n'
                 "             policies in relation to the Contractor's activities  under this "
                 'contract to Mercy Corps, which may\n'
                 '             be done via its Integrity Hotline website ( '
                 'www.mercycorps.org/integrityhotline ). Contractor\n'
                 '             will ensure that it has the capacity to abide by these policies, '
                 'that its employees and\n'
                 '             subcontractors understand these policies, and that it communicates '
                 'to its employees and\n'
                 '             subcontractors the duty to report. Contractor  understands and '
                 'agrees that a violation of these\n'
                 '             policies may, in addition to any other remedies available under '
                 'this Contract or at law, result\n'
                 '             in suspension or immediate termination of this C ontract and may '
                 'also result in Contractor being\n'
                 '             deemed ineligible for future contracts with Mercy Corps.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      l.                                       Independent Contractor.   The '
                 'parties intend to be independent contractors.  Supplier will be\n'
                 '             solely responsible for and have control over the means, methods, '
                 'techniques, personnel and\n'
                 '             procedures for supplying goods.  Neither party will   be deemed an '
                 'agent or partner of the other\n'
                 '             party.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Purchase Contract No: '
                 'SAMPLE                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              '
                 'PAGE 4 OF 14',
                 '13.     Confidentiality.   Supplier will maintain the confidentiality of: (i) '
                 'any information Mercy Corps\n'
                 'provides to Supplier that Mercy Corps identifies as c onfidential; (ii) the '
                 'terms and conditions of this\n'
                 'Contract; and (iii) nonpublic info rmation regarding Mercy Corps’ po licies and '
                 'practices.  Upon Mercy\n'
                 'Corps’ request, Supplier will return to Mercy Corps all confidential information '
                 'provided by Mercy\n'
                 'Corps to Supplier.  This confidentiality obligation   will survive final '
                 'acceptance of the Goods, payment\n'
                 'of the purchase price and termination of this Contract.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '14.     Indemnification.   Supplier will indemnify Mercy Corps and each of its '
                 'officers, directors,\n'
                 'employees, representatives and agents (each, an “Indemnitee”), and hold them '
                 'harmless from, any and\n'
                 'all losses, claims, damages, liabilities, any government  or donor '
                 'investigations, fines or penalties and\n'
                 'related expenses (including incidental and consequential damages and reasonable '
                 'attorneys’ fees,\n'
                 'whether incurred at the investigative, trial or appe llate level or otherwise) '
                 'incurred by any Indemnitee\n'
                 'or asserted against any Indemnitee by any third party or by Supplier arising out '
                 'of, in connection with,\n'
                 'or as a result of this Contract, any failure by Supplier   to fully perform its '
                 'obligations under this Contract\n'
                 'or any breach by Supplier of any of its representations  and warranties under '
                 'this Contract, provided that\n'
                 'such indemnity will not, as to any Indemnitee, be av ailable to the extent that '
                 'such losses, claims,\n'
                 'damages, liabilities or related expenses resulted from the gross negligence or '
                 'willful misconduct of\n'
                 'such Indemnitee.  This indemnity obligation will  survive final acceptance of '
                 'the Goods, payment of the\n'
                 'purchase price and termination of this Contract.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '15.  Termination and Remedies.   This Contract may be terminated under the '
                 'following\n'
                 '      circumstances:\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      a.                              by both Parties on mutual written '
                 'agreement of the Parties;\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      b.             by Mercy Corps immediately upon written notice in the event '
                 'Mercy Corps’ donor(s)\n'
                 '             terminates or withdraws funding that Mercy Corps would use to pay '
                 'Contractor under this\n'
                 '             Contract;\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      c.                                by either Party due to the '
                 'non-terminating Party’s br  each of this Contract and failure to correct\n'
                 '             such breach within 15 days prior notice of such breach;\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      d.                 be either Party upon written notice if a force majeure '
                 'event, including any not reasonably\n'
                 '             foreseeable war, insurrection, change in law or  government action '
                 'or inaction, strike, natural\n'
                 '             disaster or similar event, prevents the terminating Party from '
                 'being able to fulfill its obligations\n'
                 '             under this Contract; or\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      e.                   by Mercy Corps immediately upon written notice if '
                 'Mercy Corps using its sole discretion\n'
                 '             determines that Contractor has or will breach any  of its '
                 'warranties, covenants or representations\n'
                 '             in this Contract, in which case Mercy Corps may withhold any and '
                 'all amounts owed to\n'
                 '             Contractor until such breach is remedied.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '             In the event termination is due to Mercy Corp s’ breach of this '
                 'Contract, by Mercy Corps for\n'
                 'Mercy Corps convenience, due to force majeure event, or due to loss of funding, '
                 'Mercy Corps shall be\n'
                 'obligated to pay Contractor for its reasonable, pro -rated costs of work '
                 'completed and expenses properly\n'
                 'incurred prior to termination.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '             If Mercy Corps determines that Supplier has or  will breach any of '
                 'its warranties, covenants or\n'
                 'representations in this Contract, Mercy Corps may, in addition to any other '
                 'remedies for such breach\n'
                 'available at law or in equity, (i) terminate this Contract; (ii) reject any '
                 'Goods delivered; (iii) return any\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Purchase Contract No: '
                 'SAMPLE                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              '
                 'PAGE 5 OF 14',
                 'Goods already accepted and obtain full repayment for any amount paid for such '
                 'Goods; (iv)  if Supplier\n'
                 'breaches Section 10(j), withhold payment until such investigation, suspension or '
                 'debarment is lifted;\n'
                 'and (v) if Supplier breaches any of Section 10(e), (f), (g), (h) or (i), not pay '
                 'for any Goods that have\n'
                 'been accepted but that have been consumed or othe  rwise cannot be returned to '
                 'Supplier and report the\n'
                 'breach to Mercy Corps donors and appropriate  governmental authorities.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '16.      Dispute Resolution.   Any unresolved dispute or claims will be settled '
                 'by arbitration administered\n'
                 'by the International Centre for Dispute Resolution in accordance with its '
                 'International Arbitration\n'
                 'Rules.  The number of arbitrators will be one.  The place of arbitration will be '
                 'Portland, Oregon.  The\n'
                 'language of the arbitration will be English.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '17.    Access to Books and Records.   Mercy Corps, its donors (including, if '
                 'applicable, USAID, and\n'
                 'the Comptroller General of the United States) and any of their respective '
                 'representatives will have\n'
                 'access to any books, documents, papers and records of  Supplier that are '
                 'directly pertinent to this\n'
                 'Contract for the purpose of making audits, examina tions, excerpts and '
                 'transcriptions or a period of\n'
                 'seven years following the completion of the Contract.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '18.    Additional Donor Terms and Conditions .   The Donor Terms (if any) are '
                 'incorporated in this\n'
                 'Contract by reference and are fully binding on Supplie r and Mercy Corps.  In '
                 'the event of a conflict\n'
                 'between the Donor Terms and this Contract or an y other document between '
                 'Supplier and Mercy Corps,\n'
                 'the Donor Terms will prevail.\n'

                 '\n'

                 'parties hereto will be governed by and\n'
                 '             construed in accordance with the laws of the St ate of Oregon '

                 '             Convention on Contracts for the International Sale  of Goods), '

                 'luding the right to receive monies due) will be\n'
                 '             assigned without the prior written consent of  Mercy Corps.  Any '
                 'assignment without such\n'
                 '             consent will be void.  Mercy Corps may assign its rights under this '
                 'Contract.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      c.                        All notices provided for herein will be in '
                 'writing and will be delivered by hand or overnight\n'
                 '             courier service, email or fax in accordance with each party’s '
                 'contact information set forth on\n'
                 '             Schedule I.  Notices will be deemed to have been given when '
                 'received, provided that notices\n'
                 '             sent by email or fax will be deemed received when  sent (except '
                 'that, if not sent during normal\n'
                 '             business hours for the recipient, will be deemed  received at the '
                 'opening of business on the next\n'
                 '             business day for the recipient).\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      d.                           Time is of the essence of each and every '
                 'obligation of Supplier under this Contract.\n'
                 '\n'

                 'is prohibited by    or invalid under applicable law, such provision\n'
                 '             will be ineffective only to the extent of such  prohibition or '
                 'invalidity without invalidating the\n'
                 '             remainder of such provision or any re maining provisions of this '
                 'Contract.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      f.                        Except as otherwise provided above, this Contr '
                 'act may be amended or modified only by a\n'
                 '             written document signed by both parties.  This Contract constitutes '
                 'the entire contract between\n'
                 '             the parties relating to the subject matter hereof and supersedes '
                 'any and all previous Contracts\n'

                 'matter hereof.\n'

                 'Mercy Corps, in accordance with donor regulations,  requires certain '

                 'forth herein, to be included in all contracts.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '1.                                  The Contractor must not engage in '
                 'transactions w ith, or provide resources or support to, individuals\n'
                 '      and organizations associated with terrorism, incl uding those individuals '
                 'or entities that appear on\n'
                 '      the Specially Designated Nationals and Blocked Persons List maintained by '
                 'the U.S. Treasury\n'
                 '      (online at: '
                 'http://www.treasury.gov/resource-center/sanctions/SDNList/Pages/default.aspx) or '
                 'the\n'
                 '      United Nations Security designation list (online at:\n'
                 '      http://www.un.org/sc/committees/1267/aq_sanctions_list.shtml).\n'
                 '\n'
                 '2.                 Contractor certifies that neither it nor its principals is '
                 'presently excluded or disqualified from\n'
                 '      participation in this transaction by any  US Government department or '
                 'agency.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '3.                         Contractor certifies that it will not and has not '
                 'used  any funds received directly or indirectly from\n'
                 '      the U.S. Government to pay any person or organi zation for influencing or '
                 'attempting to influence\n'
                 '      an officer or employee of any agency, a member of  U.S. Congress, officer '
                 'or employee of Congress,\n'
                 '      or an employee of a member of Congress in conn ection with obtaining this '
                 'Contract or any other\n'
                 '      U.S. government funded project.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '4.                 Mercy Corps, USAID, and the Comptroller General of the United '
                 'States, or any of their duly\n'
                 '      authorized representatives, shall have access to any books, documents, '
                 'papers and records of\n'
                 '      Contractor which are directly pertinent to this Contract for the purpose '
                 'of making audits,\n'
                 '      examinations, excerpts and transcriptions.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '5.                            The Contractor or its employees, or any '
                 'Subcontract or or its employees, must not engage in any of\n'
                 '      the following conduct:\n'
                 '        (i) Trafficking in persons (as defined in the Protocol to Prevent, '
                 'Suppress, and Punish Trafficking\n'
                 '               in Persons, especially Women and Children, supplementing the UN '
                 'Convention against\n'
                 '               Transnational Organized Crime) during the period of this '
                 'Contract;\n'
                 '        (ii) Procure a commercial sex act during the period of this Contract;\n'
                 '        (iii) Use forced labor in the performance of the Contract; or\n'
                 '        (iv) Commit acts that directly support or advance trafficking in '
                 'persons, including the following\n'
                 '               acts:\n'
                 '                    a. Destroying, concealing, confiscating, or  otherwise '
                 'denying an employee access to that\n'
                 "                         employee's identity or immigration documents;\n"
                 '\n'
                 '                    b. Failing to provide return transportation or  pay for '
                 'return transportation costs to an\n'
                 '                         employee from a country outside the United States to '
                 'the country from which the\n'
                 '                         employee was recruited upon the end of employment if '
                 'requested by the employee,\n'
                 '                         unless:\n'
                 '\n'
                 '                           \uf0b7                                           '
                 'exempted from the requirement to provide or pay for such return transportation '
                 'by\n'
                 '                                 Mercy Corps under this award; or\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Purchase Contract No: '
                 'SAMPLE                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              '
                 'PAGE 11 OF 14',
                 '                           \uf0b7                          the employee is a '
                 'victim of human trafficking seeking victim services or legal\n'
                 '                                  redress in the country of employment or a '
                 'witness in a human trafficking\n'
                 '                                  enforcement action;\n'
                 '\n'
                 '                    c. Soliciting a person for the purpose of empl oyment, or '
                 'offering employment, by means\n'
                 '                         of materially false or fraudulent pretenses, '
                 'representations, or promises regarding that\n'
                 '                         employment;\n'
                 '\n'
                 '                    d. Charging employees recruitment fees ; or\n'
                 '\n'
                 '                    e. Providing or arranging housing that fails  to meet the '
                 'host country housing and safety\n'
                 '                         standards.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      Contractor agrees to report in a timely manner to  Mercy Corps any '
                 'credible information from any\n'
                 '      source that alleges the contractor or any sub-contractor has engaged in '
                 'any of the prohibited\n'
                 '      activities identified in this provision.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '6.                       The Contractor must inform its employees working under '
                 'this contract in the predominant native\n'
                 '      language of the workforce that they are afforded  the employee '
                 'whistleblower rights and protections\n'
                 '      provided under 41 U.S.C. § 4712; and\n'
                 '\n'
                 '7.                           Prohibition on Requiring Certain Internal Conf '
                 'identiality Agreements or Statements\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      (a)       The Contractor must not require its employees or sub-contractors '
                 'to sign or comply with\n'
                 '             internal confidentiality agreements or statements that prohibit or '
                 'otherwise restrict employees\n'
                 '             or sub-contractors from lawfully reporting waste,  fraud, or abuse '
                 'related to the performance of\n'
                 '             this contract to Mercy Corps or to USAID’s Office of the Inspector '
                 'General.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      (b)     The Contractor must notify current employees and sub-contractors '
                 'that prohibitions and\n'
                 '             restrictions of any preexisting internal confidentia lity '
                 'agreements or statements covered by this\n'
                 '             provision, to the extent that such prohibitions and restrictions '
                 'are inconsistent with the\n'
                 '             prohibitions of this provision, are no longer in effect.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      (c)         If Mercy Corps, USAID or other authorized offi cials of the US '
                 'Government determines that\n'
                 '             the Contractor is not in compliance with the requirements of this '
                 'provision, Mercy Corps may,\n'
                 '             at its sole discretion, suspend or terminate the c ontract.  '
                 'Further, Mercy Corps may, at its sole\n'
                 '             discretion, decide not pay a portion or all of  amounts invoiced or '
                 'expenditures incurred, as\n'
                 '             applicable, by the Contractor with funds provided  under this '
                 'contract, and also may require the\n'
                 '             Contractor to refund a portion or all of any amount  s paid to the '
                 'Contractor under this contract.\n'

                 'or as defined in 2 CFR 200.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '             “Internal confidentiality agreement or statement” means a '
                 'confidentiality agreement or any\n'
                 '             other written statement that the Contractor requi res any of its '
                 'employees or sub-contractors to\n'
                 '             sign regarding nondisclosure of recipient information, except that '
                 'it does not include\n'

                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Purchase Contract No: '
                 'SAMPLE                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              '
                 'PAGE 12 OF 14',
                 '             confidentiality agreements arising out of civil litigation or '
                 'confidentiality agreements that\n'
                 '             Contractor employees or sub-contractors sign at the behest of a US '
                 'government agency.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      (e)              The Contractor must include this provision, incl  uding '
                 'this paragraph (e), in subawards and sub-\n'
                 '             contracts funded under this contract.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '8.                            Contractor must disclose, in a timely manner, in '
                 'writing to the USAID Office of Inspector General\n'
                 '      and Mercy Corps all violations of US government  criminal law involving '
                 'fraud, bribery or gratuity\n'
                 '      violations potentially affecting this Contract.\n'

                 '9.          USAID policy requires that the contractor not discriminate against '
                 'any beneficiaries in\n'
                 '      implementation of this contract, such as, but not  limited to, by '
                 'withholding, adversely impacting,\n'
                 '      or denying equitable access to the benefits provide  d through this '
                 'contract on the basis of any factor\n'
                 '      not expressly stated in the contract. This includes,  for example, race, '
                 'color, religion, sex (including\n'
                 '      gender identity, sexual orientation, and pregnancy), national origin, '
                 'disability, age, genetic\n'
                 '      information, marital status, parental status, political  affiliation, or '
                 "veteran's status. Nothing in this\n"
                 '      provision is intended to limit the ability of the c ontractor to target '
                 'activities toward the assistance\n'
                 '      needs of certain populations as defined in the contract.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '10.     Fly America Act\n'
                 '\n'
                 '      The Fly America Act (49 U.S.C. 40118) requires that all air travel and '
                 'shipments under this\n'
                 '      Contract must be made on U.S. flag carriers to the extent service by such '
                 'carriers is available. The\n'
                 '      US Government Administrator of General Services  Administration (GSA) is '
                 'authorized to issue\n'
                 '      regulations for purposes of implementation. Those regulations may be found '
                 'at 41 CFR part 301,\n'
                 '      and are hereby incorporated by re ference into this Contract.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '11.     Prohibition on Providing Funds to the Enemy\n'
                 '\n'
                 '11.1 If the value of this Contract is USD $50,000 or more, the Contractor must—\n'
                 '\n'
                 'a.                         Exercise due diligence to ensure that none of the  '
                 'funds received under this contract are provided\n'
                 '      directly or indirectly (including through subcontracts) to a person  or '
                 'entity who is actively opposing\n'
                 '      the United States or coalition forces involved in  a contingency operation '
                 'in which members of the\n'
                 '      Armed Forces are actively engaged in hostilities; (2)  Terminate or void '
                 'in whole or in part any sub\n'
                 '      contract with a person or entity listed in SAM as a  prohibited or '
                 'restricted source pursuant to subtitle\n'
                 '      E of Title VIII of the NDAA for FY 2015, unless Mercy Corps provides '
                 'written approval to\n'
                 '      continue the contract.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 '\n'
                 'Purchase Contract No: '
                 'SAMPLE                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              '
                 'PAGE 13 OF 14',
                 ' b.                            Mercy Corps has the authority to te rminate this '
                 'Contract, in whole or in part, if the recipient failed\n'
                 '        to exercise due diligence as required by paragraph (a) of this clause or '
                 'otherwise violates the\n'
                 '        requirements in paragraph (a).\n'
                 '\n'
                 ' 11.2 Additional Access to Recipient Records\n'
                 '\n'
                 ' a.                              In addition to any other existing '
                 'examination-of-r  ecords authority, Mercy Corps and/or the United\n'
                 '        States government is authorized to examine any records of the Contractor '
                 'and its subcontracts to\n'
                 '        the extent necessary to ensure that funds, including supplies and '
                 'services, available under this\n'
                 '        Contract are not provided, directly or indirectly, to a person or entity '
                 'that is actively opposing\n'
                 '        United States or coalition forces involved in a  contingency operation '
                 'in which members of the\n'
                 '        Armed Forces are actively engaged in hostilities.\n'
                 '\n'
                 '11.3 The Contractor is required to include the substan ce of this clause, in '
                 'subcontracts funded under this\n'
                 '        Contract that have an estimated value over $50,000  and will be '
                 'performed outside the United States,\n'
                 '        including its outlying areas.\n'
                 '\n'
                 ' 12. Domestic preferences for procurements\n'
                 '\n'
                 ' As appropriate and to the extent consistent with law, the Contractor should, to '
                 'the greatest extent\n'
                 ' practicable, provide a preference for the purchase, ac quisition, or use of '
                 'goods, products, or materials\n'
                 ' produced in the United States (including but not limite d to iron, aluminum, '
                 'steel, cement, and other\n'
                 ' manufactured products). The requirements of this section must be included in '
                 'all contracts and purchase\n'
                 ' orders for work or products under this Contract.\n'
                 '\n'
                 ' For purposes of this section:\n'
                 '\n'
                 ' a.                ‘‘Produced in the United States’’ means, for iron and steel '
                 'products, that all manufacturing\n'
                 '        processes, from the initial melting stage through the application of '
                 'coatings, occurred in the United\n'
                 '        States.\n'
                 '\n'
                 ' b.                      ‘‘Manufactured products’’ means items  and construction '
                 'materials composed in whole or in part\n'
                 '        of non-ferrous metals such as aluminum; plastics and polymer-based '
                 'products such as polyvinyl\n'
                 '        chloride pipe; aggregates such as concrete; glass, including optical '
                 'fiber; and lumber.\n'

          'THIS PURCHASE CONTRACT (the “ Contract”) entered into as of __________ by and between\n'

          'as follows:\n'
          '\n'
          '1.                        Defined Terms.   Each of the following terms has the meaning '
          'given to such term on Schedule I\n'
          'attached hereto:  Authorized Representative, Contract Number, Delivery Date, Delivery '
          'Location,\n'
          'Delivery Terms, Donor Terms, Goods , Packing Requirements, Pricing,  and '
          'Specifications.  Other terms\n'
          'are defined as specified throughout this Contract.\n'
          '\n'
          '2.                           Purchase and Sale of Goods.   Supplier will sell to Mercy '
          'Corps, and Mercy Corps will purchase\n'
          'and pay for, the Goods in accordance with the te rms and conditions set forth in this '
          'Contract.\n'
          '\n'
          '3.                           Specifications.   The Goods must strictly comply with or '
          'exceed the Specifications listed in\n'
          'Schedule II.  No deviation, substitution or change is permitted without Mercy Corps’ '
          'prior written\n'
          'consent.\n'
          '\n'
          "4.                      Purchase Order Amendments.  Mercy Corps may suspend Supplier's "
          'performance, increase or\n'
          'decrease the ordered quantities, or make changes for Mercy Corps’ reasonable business '
          'needs by\n'
          'written notice to Supplier (each, a “Purchase Order Amendment").  Unless mutually '
          'agreed, a\n'
          'Purchase Order Amendment does not apply to change the Goods timely and fully delivered '
          'and\n'
          'accepted before the date of the Purchase Order Amendment.  If any change causes an '
          'increase or\n'
          "decrease in the cost of, or the time required for, Supplier's performance, an equitable "
          'adjustment may\n'
          'be made in the price or delivery schedule or both, if  such adjustment is set forth in '
          'a Purchase Order\n'
          'Amendment signed by the Authorized Representative.\n'
          '\n'
          '5.                           Non-Exclusivity.  This Contract is not intended to create '
          'an exclusive relationship between the\n'
          '      parties.\n'
          '\n'

          '\n'
          "      a.                                    All Goods will be subject to Mercy Corps' "
          'insp ection and testing (which may be done by a third\n'

          'subject to final\n'
          '             inspection and acceptance at the Delivery Location  within a reasonable '
          'time after delivery (but\n'
          '             in no event, less than three days after the date of delivery).\n'

          'Authorized   Representative delivers written, signed notice\n'

          'such Indemnitee.  This indemnity obligation will  survive final acceptance of the '
          'Goods, payment of the\n'

          '15.  Termination and Remedies.   This Contract may be terminated under the following\n'
          '      circumstances:\n'

          'the Parties;\n'
          '\n'
          '      b.             by Mercy Corps immediately upon written notice in the event Mercy '
          'Corps’ donor(s)\n'
          '             terminates or withdraws funding that Mercy Corps would use to pay '
          'Contractor under this\n'
          '             Contract;\n'
          '\n'
          '      c.                                by either Party due to the non-terminating '
          'Party’s br  each of this Contract and failure to correct\n'
          '             such breach within 15 days prior notice of such breach;\n'
          '\n'
          '      d.                 be either Party upon written notice if a force majeure event, '
          'including any not reasonably\n'
          '             foreseeable war, insurrection, change in law or  government action or '
          'inaction, strike, natural\n'
          '             disaster or similar event, prevents the terminating Party from being able '
          'to fulfill its obligations\n'
          '             under this Contract; or\n'
          '\n'
          '      e.                   by Mercy Corps immediately upon written notice if Mercy '
          'Corps using its sole discretion\n'
          '             determines that Contractor has or will breach any  of its warranties, '
          'covenants or representations\n'
          '             in this Contract, in which case Mercy Corps may withhold any and all '
          'amounts owed to\n'
          '             Contractor until such breach is remedied.\n'
          '\n'
          '             In the event termination is due to Mercy Corp s’ breach of this Contract, '
          'by Mercy Corps for\n'
          'Mercy Corps convenience, due to force majeure event, or due to loss of funding, Mercy '
          'Corps shall be\n'
          'obligated to pay Contractor for its reasonable, pro -rated costs of work completed and '
          'expenses properly\n'
          'incurred prior to termination.\n'
          '\n'
          '             If Mercy Corps determines that Supplier has or  will breach any of its '
          'warranties, covenants or\n'
          'representations in this Contract, Mercy Corps may, in addition to any other remedies '
          'for such breach\n'
          'available at law or in equity, (i) terminate this Contract; (ii) reject any Goods '
          'delivered; (iii) return any\n'
          '\n'
          '\n'
          '\n'
          'Purchase Contract No: '
          'SAMPLE                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              '
          'PAGE 5 OF 14\n'
          '\n'
          'Goods already accepted and obtain full repayment for any amount paid for such Goods; '
          '(iv)  if Supplier\n'
          'breaches Section 10(j), withhold payment until such investigation, suspension or '
          'debarment is lifted;\n'
          'and (v) if Supplier breaches any of Section 10(e), (f), (g), (h) or (i), not pay for '
          'any Goods that have\n'
          'been accepted but that have been consumed or othe  rwise cannot be returned to Supplier '
          'and report the\n'
          'breach to Mercy Corps donors and appropriate  governmental authorities.\n'
          '\n'
          '16.      Dispute Resolution.   Any unresolved dispute or claims will be settled by '
          'arbitration administered\n'
          'by the International Centre for Dispute Resolution in accordance with its International '
          'Arbitration\n'
          'Rules.  The number of arbitrators will be one.  The place of arbitration will be '
          'Portland, Oregon.  The\n'
          'language of the arbitration will be English.\n'
          '\n'
          '17.    Access to Books and Records.   Mercy Corps, its donors (including, if '
          'applicable, USAID, and\n'
          'the Comptroller General of the United States) and any of their respective '
          'representatives will have\n'
          'access to any books, documents, papers and records of  Supplier that are directly '
          'pertinent to this\n'
          'Contract for the purpose of making audits, examina tions, excerpts and transcriptions '
          'or a period of\n'
          'seven years following the completion of the Contract.\n'
          '\n'
          '18.    Additional Donor Terms and Conditions .   The Donor Terms (if any) are '
          'incorporated in this\n'
          'Contract by reference and are fully binding on Supplie r and Mercy Corps.  In the event '
          'of a conflict\n'
          'between the Donor Terms and this Contract or an y other document between Supplier and '
          'Mercy Corps,\n'
          'the Donor Terms will prevail.\n'
          '\n'
          '19.     Miscellaneous.\n'
          '\n'
          '      a.                    This Contract and the rights and obligations of the parties '
          'hereto will be governed by and\n'
          '             construed in accordance with the laws of the St ate of Oregon (exclusive '
          'of the United Nations\n'
          '             Convention on Contracts for the International Sale  of Goods), without '
          'regard to the conflict of\n'
          '             laws provisions thereof.\n'
          '\n'
          '      b.                       No right or obligation under this Contract (inc luding '
          'the right to receive monies due) will be\n'
          '             assigned without the prior written consent of  Mercy Corps.  Any '
          'assignment without such\n'
          '             consent will be void.  Mercy Corps may assign its rights under this '
          'Contract.\n'
          '\n'
          '      c.                        All notices provided for herein will be in writing and '
          'will be delivered by hand or overnight\n'
          '             courier service, email or fax in accordance with each party’s contact '
          'information set forth on\n'
          '             Schedule I.  Notices will be deemed to have been given when received, '
          'provided that notices\n'
          '             sent by email or fax will be deemed received when  sent (except that, if '
          'not sent during normal\n'
          '             business hours for the recipient, will be deemed  received at the opening '
          'of business on the next\n'
          '             business day for the recipient).\n'
          '\n'
          '      d.                           Time is of the essence of each and every obligation '
          'of Supplier under this Contract.\n'
          '\n'
          '      e.                                      If any provision of this Contract is '
          'prohibited by    or invalid under applicable law, such provision\n'
          '             will be ineffective only to the extent of such  prohibition or invalidity '
          'without invalidating the\n'
          '             remainder of such provision or any re maining provisions of this '
          'Contract.\n'
          '\n'
          '      f.                        Except as otherwise provided above, this Contr act may '
          'be amended or modified only by a\n'
          '             written document signed by both parties.  This Contract constitutes the '
          'entire contract between\n'
          '             the parties relating to the subject matter hereof and supersedes any and '
          'all previous Contracts\n'
          '             and understandings, oral or written, re lating to the subject matter '
          'hereof.\n'

          'Other USAID Contract Provisions Required by Law or Regulation\n'

          'Mercy Corps, in accordance with donor regulations,  requires certain certifications and '
          'provisions, set\n'
          'forth herein, to be included in all contracts.\n'
          '\n'
          '1.                                  The Contractor must not engage in transactions w '
          'ith, or provide resources or support to, individuals\n'
          '      and organizations associated with terrorism, incl uding those individuals or '
          'entities that appear on\n'
          '      the Specially Designated Nationals and Blocked Persons List maintained by the '
          'U.S. Treasury\n'
          '      (online at: '
          'http://www.treasury.gov/resource-center/sanctions/SDNList/Pages/default.aspx) or the\n'
          '      United Nations Security designation list (online at:\n'
          '      http://www.un.org/sc/committees/1267/aq_sanctions_list.shtml).\n'
          '\n'
          '2.                 Contractor certifies that neither it nor its principals is presently '
          'excluded or disqualified from\n'
          '      participation in this transaction by any  US Government department or agency.\n'
          '\n'
          '3.                         Contractor certifies that it will not and has not used  any '
          'funds received directly or indirectly from\n'
          '      the U.S. Government to pay any person or organi zation for influencing or '
          'attempting to influence\n'
          '      an officer or employee of any agency, a member of  U.S. Congress, officer or '
          'employee of Congress,\n'
          '      or an employee of a member of Congress in conn ection with obtaining this '
          'Contract or any other\n'
          '      U.S. government funded project.\n'
          '\n'
          '4.                 Mercy Corps, USAID, and the Comptroller General of the United '
          'States, or any of their duly\n'
          '      authorized representatives, shall have access to any books, documents, papers and '
          'records of\n'
          '      Contractor which are directly pertinent to this Contract for the purpose of '
          'making audits,\n'
          '      examinations, excerpts and transcriptions.\n'
          '\n'
          '5.                            The Contractor or its employees, or any Subcontract or or '
          'its employees, must not engage in any of\n'
          '      the following conduct:\n'
          '        (i) Trafficking in persons (as defined in the Protocol to Prevent, Suppress, '
          'and Punish Trafficking\n'
          '               in Persons, especially Women and Children, supplementing the UN '
          'Convention against\n'
          '               Transnational Organized Crime) during the period of this Contract;\n'
          '        (ii) Procure a commercial sex act during the period of this Contract;\n'
          '        (iii) Use forced labor in the performance of the Contract; or\n'
          '        (iv) Commit acts that directly support or advance trafficking in persons, '
          'including the following\n'
          '               acts:\n'
          '                    a. Destroying, concealing, confiscating, or  otherwise denying an '
          'employee access to that\n'
          "                         employee's identity or immigration documents;\n"
          '\n'
          '                    b. Failing to provide return transportation or  pay for return '
          'transportation costs to an\n'
          '                         employee from a country outside the United States to the '
          'country from which the\n'
          '                         employee was recruited upon the end of employment if requested '
          'by the employee,\n'
          '                         unless:\n'
          '\n'
          '                           \uf0b7                                           exempted '
          'from the requirement to provide or pay for such return transportation by\n'
          '                                 Mercy Corps under this award; or\n'
          '\n'
          '\n'
          '\n'
          '\n'
          'Purchase Contract No: '
          'SAMPLE                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              '
          'PAGE 11 OF 14\n'
          '\n'
          '                           \uf0b7                          the employee is a victim of '
          'human trafficking seeking victim services or legal\n'
          '                                  redress in the country of employment or a witness in '
          'a human trafficking\n'
          '                                  enforcement action;\n'
          '\n'
          '                    c. Soliciting a person for the purpose of empl oyment, or offering '
          'employment, by means\n'
          '                         of materially false or fraudulent pretenses, representations, '
          'or promises regarding that\n'
          '                         employment;\n'
          '\n'
          '                    d. Charging employees recruitment fees ; or\n'
          '\n'
          '                    e. Providing or arranging housing that fails  to meet the host '
          'country housing and safety\n'
          '                         standards.\n'
          '\n'
          '      Contractor agrees to report in a timely manner to  Mercy Corps any credible '
          'information from any\n'
          '      source that alleges the contractor or any sub-contractor has engaged in any of '
          'the prohibited\n'
          '      activities identified in this provision.\n'
          '\n'

          'contract in the predominant native\n'
          '      language of the workforce that they are afforded  the employee whistleblower '
          'rights and protections\n'
          '      provided under 41 U.S.C. § 4712; and\n'
          '\n'
          '7.                           Prohibition on Requiring Certain Internal Conf identiality '
          'Agreements or Statements\n'
          '\n'
          '      (a)       The Contractor must not require its employees or sub-contractors to '
          'sign or comply with\n'
          '             internal confidentiality agreements or statements that prohibit or '
          'otherwise restrict employees\n'
          '             or sub-contractors from lawfully reporting waste,  fraud, or abuse related '
          'to the performance of\n'

          'General.\n'
          '\n'
          '      (b)     The Contractor must notify current employees and sub-contractors that '
          'prohibitions and\n'
          '             restrictions of any preexisting internal confidentia lity agreements or '
          'statements covered by this\n'
          '             provision, to the extent that such prohibitions and restrictions are '
          'inconsistent with the\n'
          '             prohibitions of this provision, are no longer in effect.\n'
          '\n'

          'Government determines that\n'
          '             the Contractor is not in compliance with the requirements of this '
