          '10.     Fly America Act\n'
          '\n'
          '      The Fly America Act (49 U.S.C. 40118) requires that all air travel and shipments '
          'under this\n'
          '      Contract must be made on U.S. flag carriers to the extent service by such '
          'carriers is available. The\n'
          '      US Government Administrator of General Services  Administration (GSA) is '
          'authorized to issue\n'
          '      regulations for purposes of implementation. Those regulations may be found at 41 '
          'CFR part 301,\n'
          '      and are hereby incorporated by re ference into this Contract.\n'
          '\n'
          '11.     Prohibition on Providing Funds to the Enemy\n'
          '\n'
          '11.1 If the value of this Contract is USD $50,000 or more, the Contractor must—\n'
          '\n'
          'a.                         Exercise due diligence to ensure that none of the  funds '
          'received under this contract are provided\n'
          '      directly or indirectly (including through subcontracts) to a person  or entity '
          'who is actively opposing\n'
          '      the United States or coalition forces involved in  a contingency operation in '
          'which members of the\n'
          '      Armed Forces are actively engaged in hostilities; (2)  Terminate or void in whole '
          'or in part any sub\n'
          '      contract with a person or entity listed in SAM as a  prohibited or restricted '
          'source pursuant to subtitle\n'
          '      E of Title VIII of the NDAA for FY 2015, unless Mercy Corps provides written '
          'approval to\n'
          '      continue the contract.\n'
          '\n'
          '\n'
          '\n'
          '\n'
          '\n'
          '\n'
          'Purchase Contract No: '
          'SAMPLE                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              '
          'PAGE 13 OF 14\n'
          '\n'
          ' b.                            Mercy Corps has the authority to te rminate this '
          'Contract, in whole or in part, if the recipient failed\n'
          '        to exercise due diligence as required by paragraph (a) of this clause or '
          'otherwise violates the\n'
          '        requirements in paragraph (a).\n'
          '\n'
          ' 11.2 Additional Access to Recipient Records\n'
          '\n'
          ' a.                              In addition to any other existing examination-of-r  '
          'ecords authority, Mercy Corps and/or the United\n'
          '        States government is authorized to examine any records of the Contractor and '
          'its subcontracts to\n'
          '        the extent necessary to ensure that funds, including supplies and services, '
          'available under this\n'
          '        Contract are not provided, directly or indirectly, to a person or entity that '
          'is actively opposing\n'
          '        United States or coalition forces involved in a  contingency operation in which '
          'members of the\n'
          '        Armed Forces are actively engaged in hostilities.\n'
          '\n'
          '11.3 The Contractor is required to include the substan ce of this clause, in '
          'subcontracts funded under this\n'
          '        Contract that have an estimated value over $50,000  and will be performed '
          'outside the United States,\n'
          '        including its outlying areas.\n'
          '\n'
          ' 12. Domestic preferences for procurements\n'
          '\n'
          ' As appropriate and to the extent consistent with law, the Contractor should, to the '
          'greatest extent\n'
          ' practicable, provide a preference for the purchase, ac quisition, or use of goods, '
          'products, or materials\n'
          ' produced in the United States (including but not limite d to iron, aluminum, steel, '
          'cement, and other\n'
          ' manufactured products). The requirements of this section must be included in all '
          'contracts and purchase\n'
          ' orders for work or products under this Contract.\n'
          '\n'
          ' For purposes of this section:\n'
          '\n'
          ' a.                ‘‘Produced in the United States’’ means, for iron and steel '
          'products, that all manufacturing\n'
          '        processes, from the initial melting stage through the application of coatings, '
          'occurred in the United\n'
          '        States.\n'
          '\n'
          ' b.                      ‘‘Manufactured products’’ means items  and construction '
          'materials composed in whole or in part\n'
          '        of non-ferrous metals such as aluminum; plastics and polymer-based products '
          'such as polyvinyl\n'
          '        chloride pipe; aggregates such as concrete; glass, including optical fiber; and '
          'lumber.\n'
          '\n'
          ' 13.    The Contractor agrees to incorporate the terms, except for Term 11 - '
          'Prohibition on Providing\n'
          '        Funds to the Enemy, of this schedule word-for-word in all of its subcontracts '
          'funded under this\n'
          '        Contract, if any.  Term 11 is to be incorporated into subcontracts in '
          'accordance with the\n'
          '        requirements of the term.\n'
          '\n'
          '\n'

decrease in the cost of, or the time required for, Supplier's performance, an equitable adjustment may
be made in the price or delivery schedule or both, if  such adjustment is set forth in a Purchase Order
Amendment signed by the Authorized Representative.

13.     Confidentiality.   Supplier will maintain the confidentiality of: (i) any information Mercy Corps
provides to Supplier that Mercy Corps identifies as c onfidential; (ii) the terms and conditions of this
Contract; and (iii) nonpublic info rmation regarding Mercy Corps’ po licies and practices.  Upon Mercy

Corps to Supplier.  This confidentiality obligation   will survive final acceptance of the Goods, payment
of the purchase price and termination of this Contract.

[sent 2/9] page=5 start=576 end=1765 line=8 col=0 chars=1189 nonspace=1000 is_noise=False is_sentence=True layout=plain
14.     Indemnification.   Supplier will indemnify Mercy Corps and each of its officers, directors,
employees, representatives and agents (each, an “Indemnitee”), and hold them harmless from, any and
all losses, claims, damages, liabilities, any government  or donor investigations, fines or penalties and
related expenses (including incidental and consequential damages and reasonable attorneys’ fees,
whether incurred at the investigative, trial or appe llate level or otherwise) incurred by any Indemnitee
or asserted against any Indemnitee by any third party or by Supplier arising out of, in connection with,
or as a result of this Contract, any failure by Supplier   to fully perform its obligations under this Contract
or any breach by Supplier of any of its representations  and warranties under this Contract, provided that
such indemnity will not, as to any Indemnitee, be av ailable to the extent that such losses, claims,
damages, liabilities or related expenses resulted from the gross negligence or willful misconduct of
such Indemnitee.  This indemnity obligation will  survive final acceptance of the Goods, payment of the
purchase price and termination of this Contract.

16.  Dispute Resolution.   Any unresolved dispute or claims will be settled by arbitration administered
by the International Centre for Dispute Resolution in accordance with its International Arbitration
Rules.  The number of arbitrators will be one.  The place of arbitration will be Portland, Oregon.  The
language of the arbitration will be English.

17.    Access to Books and Records.   Mercy Corps, its donors (including, if applicable, USAID, and
the Comptroller General of the United States) and any of their respective representatives will have
access to any books, documents, papers and records of  Supplier that are directly pertinent to this
Contract for the purpose of making audits, examina tions, excerpts and transcriptions or a period of
seven years following the completion of the Contract.

or denying equitable access to the benefits provide  d through this contract on the basis of any factor
not expressly stated in the contract. This includes,  for example, race, color, religion, sex (including
gender identity, sexual orientation, and pregnancy), national origin, disability, age, genetic
information, marital status, parental status, political  affiliation, or veteran's status. Nothing in this
provision is intended to limit the ability of the c ontractor to target activities toward the assistance
needs of certain populations as defined in the contract.

The Fly America Act (49 U.S.C. 40118) requires that all air travel and shipments under this
Contract must be made on U.S. flag carriers to the extent service by such carriers is available. The
US Government Administrator of General Services  Administration (GSA) is authorized to issue
regulations for purposes of implementation. Those regulations may be found at 41 CFR part 301,
and are hereby incorporated by re ference into this Contract.

[sent 9/10] page=14 start=1193 end=1736 line=18 col=0 chars=543 nonspace=451 is_noise=False is_sentence=True layout=plain
 12. Domestic preferences for procurements

 As appropriate and to the extent consistent with law, the Contractor should, to the greatest extent
 practicable, provide a preference for the purchase, ac quisition, or use of goods, products, or materials
 produced in the United States (including but not limite d to iron, aluminum, steel, cement, and other
 manufactured products). The requirements of this section must be included in all contracts and purchase
 orders for work or products under this Contract.

 For purposes of this section:

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[sent 10/10] page=14 start=1736 end=2638 line=28 col=0 chars=896 nonspace=673 is_noise=False is_sentence=True layout=header
 a.                ‘‘Produced in the United States’’ means, for iron and steel products, that all manufacturing
        processes, from the initial melting stage through the application of coatings, occurred in the United
        States.

 b.                      ‘‘Manufactured products’’ means items  and construction materials composed in whole or in part
        of non-ferrous metals such as aluminum; plastics and polymer-based products such as polyvinyl
        chloride pipe; aggregates such as concrete; glass, including optical fiber; and lumber.

 13.    The Contractor agrees to incorporate the terms, except for Term 11 - Prohibition on Providing
        Funds to the Enemy, of this schedule word-for-word in all of its subcontracts funded under this
        Contract, if any.  Term 11 is to be incorporated into subcontracts in accordance with the
        requirements of the term.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

                          'its principal office in\n'

                          '\n'
                          '1.                        Defined Terms.   Each of the following terms '
                          'has the meaning given to such term on Schedule I\n'

                          'Date, Delivery Location,\n'
                          'Delivery Terms, Donor Terms, Goods , Packing Requirements, Pricing,  '

                          '\n'
                          '2.                           Purchase and Sale of Goods.   Supplier '
                          'will sell to Mercy Corps, and Mercy Corps will purchase\n'
                          'and pay for, the Goods in accordance with the te rms and conditions set '
                          'forth in this Contract.\n'
                          '\n'
                          '3.                           Specifications.   The Goods must strictly '

                          'Schedule II.  No deviation, substitution or change is permitted without '
                          'Mercy Corps’ prior written\n'
                          'consent.\n'
                          '\n'
                          '4.                      Purchase Order Amendments.  Mercy Corps may '
                          "suspend Supplier's performance, increase or\n"
                          'decrease the ordered quantities, or make changes for Mercy Corps’ '
                          'reasonable business needs by\n'
                          'written notice to Supplier (each, a “Purchase Order Amendment").  '
                          'Unless mutually agreed, a\n'
                          'Purchase Order Amendment does not apply to change the Goods timely and '
                          'fully delivered and\n'
                          'accepted before the date of the Purchase Order Amendment.  If any '
                          'change causes an increase or\n'
                          "decrease in the cost of, or the time required for, Supplier's "

                          'be made in the price or delivery schedule or both, if  such adjustment '

                          '             and assistance for the safety and convenience of Mercy '
                          "Corps' inspectors.  No inspection or\n"

                          'the requirements of this Contract.\n'

                          '             inspection and acceptance at the Delivery Location  within '
                          'a reasonable time after delivery (but\n'
                          '             in no event, less than three days after the date of '

                          'the value to Mercy Corps of the\n'
                          '            accepted Goods, (2) accept such nonconforming Go ods and '

                          '            amount as Mercy Corps determines in good faith re  flects '
                          'the reduced value to Mercy Corps of\n'
                          '            such nonconforming Goods; (3) reject all Goods;  and/or (4) '
                          'terminate this Contract without\n'
                          '            any further obligation on Mercy Corps’ part.\n'
                          '\n'
                          '      d.                       If any Goods are finally accepted, Mercy '
                          'Corp s will only pay for the quantity accepted up to\n'
                          '            the quantity specified in this Contract.  Mercy Corps will '
                          'in no event pay for quantity above\n'
                          '            the amount provided for in this Contract or accep ted.  '

                          "            shipments and non-conforming shipments at Supplier's risk "

                          'with the Packing Requirements listed in Schedule I.  Price based on '

                          'certifications and provisions, set\n'

                          '\n'

                          'against any beneficiaries in\n'
                          '      implementation of this contract, such as, but not  limited to, by '
                          'withholding, adversely impacting,\n'
                          '      or denying equitable access to the benefits provide  d through '

                          'Contractor must—\n'
                          '\n'
                          'a.                         Exercise due diligence to ensure that none '

                          '      the United States or coalition forces involved in  a contingency '

and pay for, the Goods in accordance with the te rms and conditions set forth in this Contract.

3.
Schedule II.  No deviation, substitution or change is permitted without Mercy Corps’ prior written
consent.

4.
decrease the ordered quantities, or make changes for Mercy Corps’ reasonable business needs by
written notice to Supplier (each, a “Purchase Order Amendment").  Unless mutually agreed, a
Purchase Order Amendment does not apply to change the Goods timely and fully delivered and
accepted before the date of the Purchase Order Amendment.  If any change causes an increase or
decrease in the cost of, or the time required for, Supplier's performance, an equitable adjustment may
be made in the price or delivery schedule or both, if  such adjustment is set forth in a Purchase Order
Amendment signed by the Authorized Representative.

the quantity specified in this Contract.  Mercy Corps will in no event pay for quantity above
the amount provided for in this Contract or accep ted.  Mercy Corps or its agent will hold over-
shipments and non-conforming shipments at Supplier's risk and expense for a reasonable time
awaiting Supplier's instructions.  Supplier will be ar the expense of return charges, storage
charges and other expenses for over-shi pped quantities and Goods not accepted.

All taxes, duties and other governmental charges with respect to the
manufacture/production/creation of the Goods and  the delivery of the Goods to Mercy Corps
in accordance with this Contract will be the liability of, and borne solely by, Supplier.  If the
law requires Mercy Corps to withhold taxes from payments to Supplier, Mercy Corps may
withhold those taxes and pay them to the appropriate taxing authority.  Mercy Corps will
deliver to Supplier an official notice for such  taxes.  Mercy Corps will use reasonable efforts
to minimize any taxes withheld to the extent allowed by law.

INPUT: 16.  Dispute Resolution.   Any unresolved dispute or claims will be settled by arbitration administered
by the International Centre for Dispute Resolution in accordance with its International Arbitration
Rules.  The number of arbitrators will be one.  The place of arbitration will be Portland, Oregon.  The
language of the arbitration will be English.

17.    Access to Books and Records.   Mercy Corps, its donors (including, if applicable, USAID, and
the Comptroller General of the United States) and any of their respective representatives will have
access to any books, documents, papers and records of  Supplier that are directly pertinent to this
Contract for the purpose of making audits, examina tions, excerpts and transcriptions or a period of
seven years following the completion of the Contract.

                          'THIS PURCHASE CONTRACT (the “ Contract”) entered into as of __________ '
                          'by and between\n'
                          'MERCY CORPS, a State of Washington, U.S.A. nonprofit corporation having '
                          'its principal office in\n'
                          'Portland, Oregon, U.S.A. (“Mercy Corps”) and '
                          '_____________________________ ("  Supplier") is\n'
                          'as follows:\n'
                          '\n'
                          '1.                        Defined Terms.   Each of the following terms '
                          'has the meaning given to such term on Schedule I\n'
                          'attached hereto:  Authorized Representative, Contract Number, Delivery '
                          'Date, Delivery Location,\n'
                          'Delivery Terms, Donor Terms, Goods , Packing Requirements, Pricing,  '
                          'and Specifications.  Other terms\n'
                          'are defined as specified throughout this Contract.\n'
                          '\n'
                          '2.                           Purchase and Sale of Goods.   Supplier '
                          'will sell to Mercy Corps, and Mercy Corps will purchase\n'
                          'and pay for, the Goods in accordance with the te rms and conditions set '
                          'forth in this Contract.\n'
                          '\n'
                          '3.                           Specifications.   The Goods must strictly '
                          'comply with or exceed the Specifications listed in\n'
                          'Schedule II.  No deviation, substitution or change is permitted without '
                          'Mercy Corps’ prior written\n'
                          'consent.\n'
                          '\n'
                          '4.                      Purchase Order Amendments.  Mercy Corps may '
                          "suspend Supplier's performance, increase or\n"
                          'decrease the ordered quantities, or make changes for Mercy Corps’ '
                          'reasonable business needs by\n'
                          'written notice to Supplier (each, a “Purchase Order Amendment").  '
                          'Unless mutually agreed, a\n'
                          'Purchase Order Amendment does not apply to change the Goods timely and '
                          'fully delivered and\n'
                          'accepted before the date of the Purchase Order Amendment.  If any '
                          'change causes an increase or\n'
                          "decrease in the cost of, or the time required for, Supplier's "
                          'performance, an equitable adjustment may\n'
                          'be made in the price or delivery schedule or both, if  such adjustment '
                          'is set forth in a Purchase Order\n'
                          'Amendment signed by the Authorized Representative.\n'
                          '\n'
                          '5.                           Non-Exclusivity.  This Contract is not '
                          'intended to create an exclusive relationship between the\n'
                          '      parties.\n'
                          '\n'
                          '6.                          Inspection, Acceptance and Rejection.\n'
                          '\n'

                          "to Mercy Corps' insp ection and testing (which may be done by a third\n"
                          '             party authorized by Mercy Corps), at any time and place, '
                          'including the period of\n'
                          '             manufacture/production/creation and before final acc '
                          'eptance.  If Mercy Corps inspects or tests\n'
                          "             at Supplier's premises, Supplier, without additio nal "

                          '             and assistance for the safety and convenience of Mercy '
                          "Corps' inspectors.  No inspection or\n"
                          '             testing done or not done before final insp ection and '
                          'acceptance will relieve Supplier from\n'

                          'the requirements of this Contract.\n'

                          'all Goods will be subject to final\n'
                          '             inspection and acceptance at the Delivery Location  within '
                          'a reasonable time after delivery (but\n'
                          '             in no event, less than three days after the date of '
                          'delivery).\n'

                          '11.     Invoicing and Payment.\n'
                          '\n'
                          '      a.                    Mercy Corps will have no obligation to make '
                          'any payment to Supplier with respect to the\n'
                          '             Goods until final acceptance in accordance with Section '
                          '6(b) and delivery of an invoice that\n'
                          '             fully complies with the requirements specified in this '
                          'Contract.  Invoices may only be\n'
                          '             submitted after Supplier receives a GRN.  Invoices must be '
                          'submitted within 60 days of\n'
                          '             Supplier’s acceptance of a GRN.  Mercy Corps will have no '
                          'obligation to pay an invoice\n'
                          '             submitted after 60 days or to pay an invoice  amount that '
                          'Mercy Corps disputes in a written\n'
                          '             notice to Supplier.  Each invoice must contain or attach '
                          'the following: (1) a copy of the signed\n'

                          '             assigned without the prior written consent of  Mercy '
                          'Corps.  Any assignment without such\n'
                          '             consent will be void.  Mercy Corps may assign its rights '

                          '(except that, if not sent during normal\n'
                          '             business hours for the recipient, will be deemed  received '

                          'Contract is prohibited by    or invalid under applicable law, such '
